newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar ends firmer ahead of holiday.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar ends firmer ahead of holiday.

text.p: CSCE world sugar futures Friday finished firmer and near session highs , but activity remained thin ahead of the holiday weekend.
Many players started their Memorial Day weekend early, which left volume slim at an estimated 7,289 lots against Thursday's official tally of 21,973 lots.
Benchmark July sugar ended up 0.05 cent at 11.11 cents a lb, traded 11.12 to 11.03 cents. The rest of the board settled 0.04 higher to 0.01 weaker.
Prices are expected to drift within their recent range in the near term, with producer selling limiting upside gains around the recent high of 11.21 cents.
The speculators, who have driven the recent rally, are expected to back off of their buying spree as they already hold a heavy net long position.
Open interest in July stood at 74,655 lots, as of early Thursday, down two lots from the previous session. October's open interest rose by 1,896 lots to 44,641 lots.
